perturbation.original_text: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid in full upon signing of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Partner of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid according to the payment schedule outlined in Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Promoter' has been replaced with 'Partner,' implying a different level of involvement or responsibility without defining the distinction. Additionally, changing the payment terms from 'paid in full upon signing' to 'payment schedule outlined in Exhibit A' introduces ambiguity if Exhibit A does not exist or contradicts the initial payment requirement.

perturbation.original_text: The Sponsor agrees that upon acceptance, this agreement shall be deemed to form and binding contract between the Sponsor and Promoter. The Sponsor agrees to abide by the terms set forth in the Terms and Conditions of Sponsorship agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Sponsor agrees that upon acceptance, this agreement shall be deemed to form a binding contract between the Sponsor and Fruit of Life Productions LLC. The Sponsor agrees to adhere to the guidelines established in the Event Participation Policy.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to the 'Promoter' as the counterparty, which is consistent with the beginning of the document. The modified text explicitly states 'Fruit of Life Productions LLC', introducing potential confusion as to whether 'Promoter' and 'Fruit of Life Productions LLC' are consistently interchangeable throughout the document. Furthermore, 'Terms and Conditions of Sponsorship agreement' is replaced with 'Event Participation Policy', a different and undefined term, causing further ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: Sponsor shall indemnify and hold harmless, Fruit of Life Productions LLC, its related entities, partners, agents, officers, directors, employees, attorneys, heirs, successors, and assigns from against any and all claims, losses, damages, judgments, settlements, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees and expenses), and liabilities of every kind incurred as a result of: (i) any act or omission by Sponsor or its officers, directors, entities, employees, agents; (ii) any use of Sponsor's name, logo, Website, or other information, products, or service provided by Sponsor; and/or (iii) the inaccuracy or breach of any of the covenants, representations and warranties made by Sponsor in this Agreement. (iv) any changes in company value or brand value.
perturbation.changed_text: Eco Science Solutions, Inc. shall indemnify and hold harmless, Fruit of Life Productions LLC, its related entities, partners, agents, officers, directors, employees, attorneys, heirs, successors, and assigns from against any and all claims, losses, damages, judgments, settlements, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees and expenses), and liabilities of every kind incurred as a result of: (i) any act or omission by the Organization or its officers, directors, entities, employees, agents; (ii) any use of Sponsor's name, logo, Website, or other information, products, or service provided by the Sponsor; and/or (iii) the inaccuracy or breach of any of the covenants, representations and warranties made by Sponsor in this Agreement. (iv) any changes in company value or brand value.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to 'Sponsor' for indemnification. The modified text replaces 'Sponsor' with 'Eco Science Solutions, Inc.' at the beginning of the section, but uses the term 'Organization' in clause (i). It remains 'Sponsor' in other sections. Without defining 'Organization', it's unclear whether Eco Science Solutions, Inc. and the 'Organization' are the same entity, potentially limiting the scope of indemnification, and making enforcement uncertain.
